SEARCH
Module it.polimi.is24am05
Package it.polimi.is24am05.model.playArea

Class PlayArea

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.is24am05.model.playArea.PlayArea
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PlayArea extends Object implements Serializable
The PlayArea is a matrix of Cards. Cards cannot be placed next to one another. If we imagine the PlayArea as a chessboard, Cards can only be placed on "white" cells.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • playArea

      private final Map<Tuple,PlacedSide> playArea
      The PlayArea is represented as a Map. It maps Coordinates (i, j) to the Corresponding PlayedSide This way, it is easier to handle Card Placements.

    • orderedPlacements

      private final List<PlacedSide> orderedPlacements
      Keeps track of the order in which sides are placed

    • visibleElements

      private final Map<Element,Integer> visibleElements
      This attribute keeps track of the number of visible elements on the PlayArea

    • frontier

      private final Set<Tuple> frontier
      The frontier is the set of empty Coordinates that are neighbours to an existing card.

    • blocked

      private final Set<Tuple> blocked
      This attribute keeps track of the coordinates where it is no longer possible to place a card. This might happen when a card without a corner is placed.

    • turnCount

      private int turnCount
      This counter is increased each time a card is placed. It is needed to keep track of the order of card placements.

    • minI

      protected int minI
      The following 4 attributes keep track of the boundaries of the play area. They are needed to turn the Map into an actual Matrix

    • minJ

      protected int minJ
      The following 4 attributes keep track of the boundaries of the play area. They are needed to turn the Map into an actual Matrix

    • maxI

      protected int maxI
      The following 4 attributes keep track of the boundaries of the play area. They are needed to turn the Map into an actual Matrix

    • maxJ

      protected int maxJ
      The following 4 attributes keep track of the boundaries of the play area. They are needed to turn the Map into an actual Matrix

    • PlayArea

      public PlayArea()
      Initializes an empty Play Area

  • Method Details

    • isWhite

      protected static boolean isWhite(Tuple coord)
      Parameters:
      coord - Set of coordinates to check
      Returns:
      True if the specified set of coordinates correspond to a "white" cell in the chessboard

    • getNeighbours

      public static Tuple[] getNeighbours(Tuple coord) throws InvalidCoordinatesException
      Parameters:
      coord - A "white" set of coordinates
      Returns:
      The four "white" coordinates diagonally adjacent to param
      Throws:
      InvalidCoordinatesException - If param doesn't correspond to a "white" set of coordinates

    • getNeighbour

      public static Tuple getNeighbour(Tuple coord, Corner corner)
      Parameters:
      coord - starting coordinates
      corner - direction of adjacency
      Returns:
      Returns the coordinates diagonally adjacent in the specified direction

    • updateFrontier

      private void updateFrontier(Tuple lastAdd) throws InvalidCoordinatesException
      Updates the frontier, adding the empty "white" cells adjacent to the last added card
      Parameters:
      lastAdd - Coordinates of the last added Card
      Throws:
      InvalidCoordinatesException - If the specified coordinates are not "white"

    • updateVisibleElements

      private void updateVisibleElements(Tuple coord) throws InvalidCoordinatesException
      After placing the card at the specified coordinates, updates the count of visible Elements
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinates of the card that was last added
      Throws:
      InvalidCoordinatesException - If the specified coordinates are not "white"

    • getCoveredCorner

      public static Corner getCoveredCorner(Tuple bottom, Tuple top) throws InvalidCoordinatesException
      Returns the corner that the top card is covering
      Parameters:
      bottom - Coordinates of the card that is covered
      top - Coordinates of the card on top
      Returns:
      The corner of the Bottom Card, that the Top card is covering
      Throws:
      InvalidCoordinatesException - If the two Cards are not adjacent

    • playSide

      public int playSide(Side side, Tuple coord) throws InvalidCoordinatesException, NoAdjacentCardException, PlacementNotAllowedException
      Adds the specified card to the PlayArea
      Parameters:
      side - Side of the card to play
      coord - Coordinates of the card to play
      Throws:
      InvalidCoordinatesException - If the specified coordinates are not "white"
      NoAdjacentCardException - If the specified coordinates are not diagonally adjacent to any card
      PlacementNotAllowedException - If a neighbouring card doesn't allow the placement

    • isFree

      public boolean isFree(Tuple coord)
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinates to check
      Returns:
      True if a Card can be placed at the specified Coordinates

    • isOccupied

      public boolean isOccupied(Tuple coord)
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinates to check
      Returns:
      True if a Card occupies the specified Coordinates

      attribute playArea

    • getMatrixPlayArea

      public PlacedSide[][] getMatrixPlayArea()
      Returns:
      The PlayArea, represented as a Matrix of PlayedSides.

      public Map<Element,Integer> getVisibleElements()
      Visible Elements getter
      Returns:
      attribute visibleElements

    • getFrontier

      public Set<Tuple> getFrontier()
      Returns:
      The set of coordinates where it is possible to place a Card

    • getOrderedPlacements

      public List<PlacedSide> getOrderedPlacements()
      Returns:
      All PlacedSides, ordered by the time they were placed
